page.title: 14A Local Family
page.content: The Bunburys originated in Cheshire. Barton Hall was built by Robert Audley at the beginning C17th. Thos. Hanmer left Barton to his nephew Sir William Bunbury who came to modernise and live in the Hall in 1748. The house contain- ed a gallery of fine pictures. Oliver Goldsmith visited often. Sir Henry Ed. Bunbury added to the house in 1821 and made extensive pleasure grounds. Four almshouses were built by Lieut.Gen Sir Henry Bunbury K.C.G.M.P. 7th Bart. in memory of his first wife Louisa Emilia. Henry William Bunbury was a well known caricaturist in mid C19th. At the end of the C18th a Bunbury lost the chance on the turn of a card of having a famous horse race named after him. It is now known as the Derby. How- ever he won the first Derby with Diomed and another with the filly Eleanor.
